result.execSummary:
The defendant Marshall Rubio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Graffiti, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.017(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution is paid in full from bond on file.  Joint and several with co-defendant Bradley Drews., Jackson County Case No. 15CM226.  AMENDED 4/13/16.  Pursuant to amended restitution order.  Total restitution is $1374.75.  Balance due as of 4/13/16  on 15CM229 and 15CM222 is $964.54.

Added to payment plan in 15CM222.   Total remaining balance due on this case is $374.35.     Failure to pay any part of the court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  $15.00 payment plan fee added.
Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 15CM222.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marshall Rubio

defendant.name: Rubio, Marshall
defendant.address: 4164 County Road 100 P O Box 886, Brady, TX 76825

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by telephone.  Attorney Prior appeared in court.  Defendant wishes to proceed by telphone.  Victim notification not necessary, per ADA Inlow.   Plead no contest to Counts 1 and 2 in 15CM222.  Plead no contest to the count in 15CM229. Other counts in 15CM222 to be dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.   Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the count he is pleading to.  He understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty as plead to.  Joint recommendation for $1,640.00 restitution due with co-defendant, Bradly Drews.  90 days jail.  Concurrent.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  $1,640.00 restitution due joint and several with co-defendant, Bradly Drews.  (15CM229).  60 DTP.  90 days jail, start within 60 days, by 6:00 P.M.  May serve in McColloch County, Texas, if arrangments can be made.  Concurrent. EMP and Huber allowed according to jail rules.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement within 60 days.  Review in 60 days as to payment of restitution.  Pay CC @ $100/mo starting 3/1/16.   Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  4 days credit in 15CM222.
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Prior.  Have a new offer from the State.  STC set for 12/14/15 at 3:00 pm.
Atty Prior requested STC be rescheduled; DA approved.

Pre-trial conference at 10-21-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 11-09-2015 03:00 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared through his Attorney Matthew Prior.  Attorney Prior requests warrant be quashed.  Defendant may have misunderstood court date, per Attorney.  State does not object.
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant FTA for initial appearance.  Warrant authorized.  Forf bond.
